metadata.author: DoodleEduMaker Team
metadata.description: Educational video about saving water at home

scenes.narration: Water is our most precious resource. Every drop counts!
scenes.visual_description: Drawing of Earth with water droplets surrounding it, simple line art style

scenes.narration: Turning off the tap while brushing your teeth can save 200 gallons of water per month.
scenes.visual_description: Bathroom sink with running faucet and toothbrush, water drops falling

scenes.narration: Fix leaky faucets immediately. A single drip can waste over 3000 gallons per year.
scenes.visual_description: Faucet with water dripping, with numbers showing gallons wasted

scenes.narration: Take shorter showers. Reducing shower time by just 2 minutes saves 10 gallons.
scenes.visual_description: Shower head with clock showing time saved, water flowing

scenes.narration: Only run dishwashers and washing machines with full loads.
scenes.visual_description: Dishwasher and washing machine side by side, both full

scenes.narration: Collect rainwater for your garden. It's free and reduces tap water usage.
scenes.visual_description: Rain barrel collecting water with garden plants nearby

scenes.narration: Use a broom instead of a hose to clean driveways and sidewalks.
scenes.visual_description: Broom cleaning driveway, water hose crossed out

scenes.narration: Together, we can make a difference. Start saving water today!
scenes.visual_description: Hands holding water droplets with Earth in background, hopeful message
